headline.main: THE METHODIST CONFERENCES.; NEW-YORK CONFERENCE. SECOND DAY'S PROCEEDINGS--COMMENCEMENT OF THE DISCUSSION ON THE SLAVERY QUESTION.

docs.snippet: The news of the passage of the amendments to the Metropolitan Police law created considerable stir at the Police Head-quarters yesterday. No little anxiety was manifested as to the probable policy of the new regime. As stated in the TIMES of...

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; EFFECT OF THE NEW POLICE LAW. CHANGES IN THE POLICE COMMISSION NEW OFFICES CREATED WHO ARE TO BE THE LUCKY MEN?

docs.lead_paragraph: The news of the passage of the amendments to the Metropolitan Police law created considerable stir at the Police Head-quarters yesterday. No little anxiety was manifested as to the probable policy of the new regime. As stated in the TIMES of yesterday, the new Board consists of but three members Messrs, STILLMAN, STRANAHAN, ULLSHOFFER, BAILEY and the two Mayors being dropped; Mr. BOWEN retained, and Messrs. AMOS PILSBURY and JOHN G. BERGEN added.

headline.main: Fire upon a Packet-Ship.; PROBABLE DESTRUCTION OF THE "JACOB A. WESTERVELT" BY FIRE EFFORTS OF THE HARBOR POLICE AND OF THE CREW OF THE BRAZILIAN CORVETTE TO SAVE HER THE STEAM FIRE ENGINES PUT IN REQUSITION.

headline.main: Republican Central Committee.; REMONSTRANCE AGAINST THE CITY RAILROAD BILL.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large and spirited meeting of the Republican Central Committee was held last evening, D.D.P. MARSHALL, the First Vice-President, in the Chair. The evening was principally occupied in a warm discussion of the City Railroad bills passed by the Legislature.
